intro: Bupleurum kurdicum f. typicum, commonly known as the Kurdish angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes plants known for their aromatic compounds and often used in traditional medicine. The plant features slender, branched stems and basal leaves that are pinnately lobed. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in herbal remedies for digestive and respiratory conditions.
